knimeNode.name: JSON to Spark
knimeNode.shortDescription: Creates a Spark RDD from given JSON file.

fullDescription.intro:
Creates a Spark RDD from given JSON file.
See Jackson JSON Parser documentation for more information.
Notice: This feature requires at least Spark 1.5.
fullDescription.option:
Infer the type of a collection of JSON records in three stages:
Sample given amount of records and infer the type.
Merge types by choosing the lowest type necessary to cover equal keys.
Replace any remaining null fields with string, the top type.
Feature that determines whether parser will allow use of single quotes (apostrophe, character '\'') for quoting Strings (names and String values).

ul.li: Allow numeric leading zeros: Feature that determines whether parser will allow JSON integral numbers to start with additional (ignorable) zeroes (like: 000001).

Allow non numeric numbers: Feature that allows parser to recognize set of "Not-a-Number" (NaN) tokens as legal floating number values (similar to how many other data formats and programming language source code allows it). Supported tokens: INF, -INF, Infinity, -Infinity and NaN.

ports.inPort: Spark compatible connection (HDFS, WebHDFS, HttpFS, S3, Blob Storage, ...)
Optional Spark context. If not connected a context is created based on the settings in the Spark preferences page.
